title: Installation issue: NCL fails to install due to missing ft2build.h
body:
### Steps to reproduce the issue

During the installation of NCL on freshly installed CentOS Linux 8 I have experienced a missing header, ft2build.h.
The reason for the missing header is that the cairo-ft.h header requires ft2build.h which resides inside include/freetype2 directory but the build system uses only include. 

<!-- Fill in the exact spec you are trying to build and the relevant part of the error message -->
```console
$ spack install ncl
...
$ sed '27862,27870!d' spack-build-out.txt 
cc -fopenmp -fcommon  -O  -I../../../.././include -I/var/lib/localadmin/stack/stack/opt/zen2/freetype/2.10.1-gcc-c4ear53/include  -DLinux    -DCTXT -DX11 -DPS -DPDF -DPIX   -DNeedFuncProto    -c -o cro_device.o cro_device.c
In file included from cro.h:147,
                 from cro_device.c:26:
/var/lib/localadmin/stack/stack/opt/zen2/cairo/1.16.0-gcc-idlt7l5/include/cairo/cairo-ft.h:46:10: fatal error: ft2build.h: No such file or directory
   46 | #include <ft2build.h>
      |          ^~~~~~~~~~~~
compilation terminated.
make[5]: *** [<builtin>: cro_device.o] Error 1
make[5]: Leaving directory '/dev/shm/build/zen2/localadmin/spack-stage-ncl-6.6.2-txq2fzn3s44tjlubf2iq7arcnnoer5pk/spack-src/ncarg2d/src/libncarg_gks/cdrivers'
```

### Information on your system

<!-- Please include the output of `spack debug report` -->
```console
$ spack debug report
* **Spack:** 0.15.4
* **Python:** 3.6.8
* **Platform:** linux-centos8-zen2
```
<!-- If you have any relevant configuration detail (custom `packages.yaml` or `modules.yaml`, etc.) you can add that here as well. -->
